content.raw:
Let me check that I understand your question. Are you looking for the debian/  directory used by ros-gazebo-pkgs (2.4.0), right?

It is this: https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release but bloom is generating lot of branches and tags for each release with the useful code inside.

We are using [debbuild-bloom.sh](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/src/06e7450a1783a7cac071152e4d15af4af91f23d7/jenkins-scripts/lib/debbuild-bloom-base.bash?at=bloom) to generate packages from it and I would say that useful lines to know what branch/tag are we using are 69 and 70.
content.html:
Let me check that I understand your question. Are you looking for the debian/ directory used by ros-gazebo-pkgs (2.4.0), right?

It is this: https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release but bloom is generating lot of branches and tags for each release with the useful code inside.

We are using debbuild-bloom.sh to generate packages from it and I would say that useful lines to know what branch/tag are we using are 69 and 70.

content.raw:
My question is where are the debian/ directory for the gazebo packages built ending up at http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu/pool/main/g/gazebo-current/ is located.

None of the control files in this repository generate packages that are named gazebo-current (unless I somehow missed one looking through the branches).

The reason that I need a package named gazebo-current is because the bloom package sources generated are build-dependent on gazebo-current (specifically https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release tag debian/ros-hydro-gazebo-plugins_2.4.0-1_raring's [control file](https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release/blob/debian/ros-hydro-gazebo-plugins_2.4.0-1_raring/debian/control))
content.html:
My question is where are the debian/ directory for the gazebo packages built ending up at http://packages.osrfoundation.org/gazebo/ubuntu/pool/main/g/gazebo-current/ is located.

None of the control files in this repository generate packages that are named gazebo-current (unless I somehow missed one looking through the branches).

The reason that I need a package named gazebo-current is because the bloom package sources generated are build-dependent on gazebo-current (specifically https://github.com/ros-gbp/gazebo_ros_pkgs-release tag debian/ros-hydro-gazebo-plugins_2.4.0-1_raring's control file)

content.raw: Ah sorry for the confusion. It was built using an experiment called gazebo2 (finally it does not exist at all) and the data to build it is in #!/osrf/gazebo2-release. Give me some hours and I will move and change values there.

content.raw:
Should be available in correct format and name under:
#!/osrf/gazebo-current-release
